title: 110_hr1376
content: The "Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007" establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. The Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007 mandates coverage for independent foster care adolescents under Medicaid. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act to include this category. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act regarding Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to specific subsections related to Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to specific subsections related to Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents, including revisions to subsections (b), (I), and (b)(3) by updating references from "XVIII" to "XVII" in various sections. The amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to specific subsections related to Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents, including updating references from "XVIII" to "XVII" in various sections. The effective date for these amendments is for calendar quarters beginning on or after October 1, 2007, with exceptions for states requiring additional legislation to meet the new requirements. The State plan will not fail to comply with Medicaid requirements solely for not meeting additional requirements before the first day of the first calendar quarter after the State legislature's session following the enactment of the Act. Each year of a 2-year legislative session is considered a separate regular session.
